intro: Indosasa glabrata var. albohispidula, commonly known as the white-hairy indosasa, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
